review:
[see next paragraph for my review]
REPORTING BUG: For some reason when you are typing, double tap does NOT highlight the word (like it normally does on iPhone), and if you “long press” to try and move the cursor somewhere (which is what happens normally), it decides to highlight the entire word instead. The “short press” to put the cursor to another place is kinda hit or miss, it doesnt always work, not sure why... I never have that issue using other apps!! Please make the cursor & tap responses aligned with regular typing - this bug making the keyboard functions all opposite is getting REALLY irritating, and decreasing my propensity to use the app!

—————————
REVIEW:
I really like this app, and as other users have mentioned it is pretty relaxing! I love the pastel colors / soft tones, and the user flow is very easy. The rounded corners and cute faces/icons are what adds to the vibe of this app. They have beautiful images too, for your entry, or there’s an option also to upload your own images for the day:)

I used to have a journal, but I didnt like wasting paper, and I also had an online diary, but remembering to log-in on my computer everyday seemed like a chore, so I never kept up with it... I love being able to do this quickly on my phone once a day, it really lowers the barrier to keeping up! I’ve been writing something every day for over a week, which is something I never thought would happen!!!  Huge step for me.

I do find it disappointing that I have to pay to see ANY stats.  Of course getting into journaling again was a goal of mine, so just for that, the free version has been good... But a BIG selling point on their end was the AI capabilities, which I don’t get to reap the benefits of.

Perhaps there are other ways to set up revenue streams, aside from charging us to see any stats? Maybe a Tier system, where the Free version has Basic stats, and as you pay more, you can see more stats, and get more personalized displays / recommendations based on the AI’s analysis... things like that. Most apps using freemium model have multiple options in the app for users to decide what to pay for, not just one. Get creative & make stats free by offering other paid functions!!

For Example: I think a really cool thing that I would love (if I had the money), would be different ways to display my entries visually. Kind of like a digital version of an info graphic  or calendar, or the option to sync the entries with my other calendar apps (google cal, iCal, period tracking), or even the option to print out your entries on paper in a cool poster/comic type of away!! So many possibilities.

Clearly the Reflectly team has an eye for aesthetics, so I think that would be a place where they could shine!!

review:
I’ve never written an app review before but I feel strongly about this. I got this app right about when quarantine went into place, and I was using it as a way to process my conflicting and confusing emotions about self-isolation. It was so therapeutic and one of the parts of my day I looked forward to... getting to go through all the motions of creating an entry with daily quotes and questions. 

But the new layout has completely changed my experience. Most of the functions you initially had access to are things you now have to pay for —which is super lame and inconvenient (especially for a teenager who was just appreciative for the space to vent and process). With the pictures gone and the significantly shortened daily entry options, it is much less pleasant, and quite frankly, a disappointment. 

Also, I am prone to writing in my journal right before I go to sleep. Often, this is past midnight, and my entries are therefore automatically logged as the day after the one I am writing about. It was incredibly efficient to be able to select the day before to properly keep track of my progression. This function is now gone. [*edit this particular function has since been remedied] 

Overall, the update was a total let-down and I would much prefer that it reverted back to its previous version. Of course, I am only a consumer, but isn’t that the point? Shouldn’t that be enough for my opinion to matter? Otherwise what is the point of customer feedback? I don’t mean to be dramatic but like I said, I feel strongly about this, and if a touch of drama increases the likelihood of drawing attention to my concerns, c’est la vie. 

Please take my complaint into consideration.
title: Recent Update is 👎

review: honestly i’m very sad and disappointed with this app. i have loved it so much since i first started journaling in february. i got this because i love to look back and read over my days from the past, and i love journaling, but i would never be motivated to do so. i also wanted this to be able to vent and try to help with the average 13 year old girl emotions and insecurities. i have loved this app and been journaling every day since i got it, however just recently they did an update. when i opened the app this morning, i almost cried because i thought the app had deleted all of my stories and my account. i have the free subscription. luckily, i had the account written down, but if not i would have lost all of my stories, and they mean so much to me. if they were gone, my heart would have broken. i checked out the new version to find that the app was completely different. i could not journal for missed days, which i loved, and i couldn’t journal for one day and have a title and all that. all you could do were “moments” and i hate that. i also found that the meaningful prompts were gone! completely removed. that was one of my favorite features of the app that you wouldn’t get with a normal journal or even most apps. i am also disappointed and confused with the new layout. i loved the old simplistic and pretty layout of the old app, it was interesting and easy to navigate. now it is weird and confusing. i am so sad that this has been messed up in the way that it has. i plan on deleting this if it is not fixed and back to normal. please fix this app back to the amazing app it used to be.

title: Reflectly

review:
I am a big fan of your app, and I have been using it since January. It has helped me with SO MUCH. I used to love writing my story, answering my daily question of the day, titling my story, and getting a cute cover for each story. I also loved to favorite all of my stories, and go back and write a story for days I missed. Everything was so organized, and the colors and formatting were beautiful. 

Yesterday when I went to write, I got logged out of my account. Thankfully, I remembered my password and stuff so I didn’t lose all of my stories. When I got into my diary, it looked so depressing. All of my cute covers were gone. You can’t even title your stories anymore. I used to love writing a catchy title for my story each day. You have to pay for the daily questions now, which I don’t like cus I cannot afford premium. You also cannot go back to another day and write stories from days you missed. Everything is in a timeline, and in a mess. Formatting is awful. You can’t change the background color anymore-heck you can’t even LIKE or HEART a story anymore. 

I really used to enjoy this app, but now I am not really liking it after this new update. This new update is making me anxious, and depressed. I feel like I can’t write anymore, and it makes me feel terrible. Lots of other users are complaining too. Not just me. This update is very unsettling. I can’t even do what I want with my diary anymore. I am very upset. 

If you can bring back the old version, you would make everybody’s days-especially during this difficult time. PLEASE REFLECTLY. BRING IT BACK. 

Otherwise, you are going to lose customers, and your app is gonna suffer a tragic financial shutdown. 

PLEASE. FROM THE BOTTOM OF MY HEART. 

BRING. IT BACK.
title: PLEASE!  BRING BACK OLD VERSION 💔💔😭😭

title: Reflectly

review: I’ve been using this app for about a week now, and I love it already. The look and feel of it is really nice, and I just generally love the aesthetic and all the little things you can do with the little emotes in mood check-ins. However, I wish that reflections weren’t locked behind a paywall, but I do still love the app though, especially the reflections. I love that it gives you a more specific question to think about and write something about that isn’t just “How are you?”, and I wish I could use it more because it generally puts me in a better mood.Overall, love the app and would recommend, even if just for keeping your thoughts straight like I use it for.
title: Great app, but the paywall is a little irritating

review: I’m not one to make negative reviews. I understand making an app takes a lot of time and dedication, and I only rated this two stars because up until three days ago I loved this app. It made me feel productive and more relaxed once I went over my day. I LOVED IT. However, I guess with the new update, now we have “limited space” to journal. That is really frustrating because we already don’t have all the features for free, and now you take away the free journaling altogether? That’s pretty lame. I don’t want to spend $59.99 a MONTH just to have an app about journaling. I understand you need to make money as developers but come on! I loved your app because it provided a good service FOR FREE, and now it doesn’t. Simple as that. Get this app. Go ahead. But just know time is going to run out and you’ll have to pay to journal with no perks. I loved Reflectly, now I hate it. Come on developers.
title: I hate to say this..

review:
First, they charged me $30 for a premium subscription when I first opened the app. (Quick background, I'm a 32 year old engineer and understand how to use an iPhone, but still somehow accidentally paid for a year long subscription.) After two days of not being able to use the app, I was finally able to create an account and log my first journal entry. 

As soon as I finished, I was offered a "special deal" for a now $60 premium subscription marked down from some even more absurd amount. After turning that scam offer down, I was finally able to use the app from the main menu. Only to find out that I had apparently only paid for a basic membership, which I was under the impression was free. That's when I noticed the "just for you" button with a heart at the top of the screen.

Well, just for me, was another offer for a premium membership.... This time a little cheaper at only $18 for an annual membership. Clearly this raised some concerns so I found the settings/menu of the app - which confirmed that I only had a basic membership, contrary to my credit card statement that clearly shows a $29.99 charge. I immediately went to my subscriptions through my apple ID to see what that said and, of course, it showed that I have a premium account. Go figure. Now, not only did I have a premium account, I had a $60/year premium account. That was the final red flag for me. 

I'll be filling a complaint with the app store and immediately notifying my credit card company of this fraudulent charge. 

I came here for help. I'm extremely disappointed. I strongly suggest not submitting your mental health to this.
title: Scam

title: Cool app

review:
—————————————————

Never thought I’d be writing a review but here we are, reflectly let me start by saying helped me through my anxiety. I had anxiety problems since 2020 September, 9, 2020. What involved me into anxeity was because of the 9/11 attack, me being myself I looked up on that day about 9/11 on YouTube. I watched these movies trying to make a remake of the movie, I watched clips and it made my brain at the time feel sad but never scared. That night, I couldn’t sleep I never new why or what it could be cause I can always sleep. I also had no sugar that night, it was strange. I kept breathing heavily but I didn’t notice it, I couldn’t sleep for a long time till I had to take a sleep pill. I was shaking and it was bad. This anxiety lasted for 2-4 days. I tried looking up calming videos on YouTube but they actually never helped me once, not even a little. I this staying up late messed up my beautiful sleep schedule to the point where I almost stayed up all night. It was bad, I was flunking school and on top of it with covid 19 I thought this was the new me. Luckly I never had a anxiety attack. I started looking up apps to help me sleep and then I came across reflectly. I downloaded it then tried it, I started to written my feelings and I saw quotes. They helped me calm down. They also had friendly calming reminders for me when I needed it through the day. I do recommend reflectly because not only did it help my health, but it’s kind of fun! After a few days of the app my anxiety faded away 
thankfully. Thank you reflectly, I appreciate your help. 5 stars ⭐️.

review: I was having an amazing experience with reflectly until tonight when I tried to use it.Every time  I’ve opened since Christmas, I believe, there has been an add about reflectly premium. I have skipped over these ads because I do not want to buy and have no intention of buying it in the future. I skipped over that add today and was about to write a check-in when I then get the message saying something along the lines of “Woah, we see you trying to write so we’ve decided to make something special for.” I believed that this was going to be a nice note or just something sweet for the users but it was actually an add for reflectly premium again, however this time, I couldn’t get around it. I am actually not able to use the app anymore unless I get reflectly premium! If this was you intentions the whole time, just make the app not be free. That way people know what they are getting into. I knew that I wasn’t going to get all of the best features but I didn’t know that after a certain amount of time, I would not be able to make entries. Reflectly has been my way of relieving stress and after everything that happened with the US government, I was looking forward to it. This was just a major slap in the face after I had been having a very good time on the app. Other than that, reflectly has been amazing. It’s very helpful for me and allows me to write all of my things down in my head whenever I want which is very helpful.
title: Good until recently

This app really helped me express things when I couldn't talk to anyone it put things into writers bc of the way it walks through things- but sadly I'll b in the market for a new free app. That I can use. ❤️

I have just gotten this app tonight, so far it is very helpful and working great. I get notified quotes (amount of my choice and period of time), which really boosts my confidence and does help a bit with my anxiety. You can schedule things on this to help become more organized. Organization is good for your mental health. The only complaint I have with the app is, I get notifications on my gmail app. I would appreciate if my quotes got notified on the app itself. I love the quotes, but my Gmail inbox will be quite full, due to the 20 quotes per day that I set in the app. I know it is difficult and takes long to code these types of things into the app, but please take this into consideration for me and the customers well being. I am not demanding, but I think that it would improve the app!   :)

Reflectly isn’t only a place to write things in, but it picks the best quotes just for you to make you feel better! It also has sections like “what happened today?” Or “what would you like to improve on?” And that is one of my favorite things. It also lets you reread your stories to reflect. review:
During the on boarding process, you have to choose a subscription option before you can start your free trial. There was a round about of going to the App Store to choose your subscription, and there was a multitude of prices without descriptions $9.99/mo, $29.99, $47.99/yr etc. Apparently, not all subscription types have a free trial. I was charged $29.99 up front without the free trial. I would’ve been ok with it if I were given that info, but I wasn’t. 

My suggestion to devs: Make sure users are fully informed of what they’re purchasing. They trust you with their money. This is especiallyyyy if you’re gonna have them sign up for a subscription before they even start the free trial. 

Because I was charged unknowingly, I am not even considering trying the app. I contacted your CS, who directed me to itunes to get my refund back. All I got was “I’m sorry, we’re not responsible for billing. You need to check in with Apple for that.” CS couldn’t even look into why? Or explain to me the different subscription options?? Yikes!!! 

Hoping the dev team looks at this review for consideration. I’m sure this is a great app, but the onboarding/purchase process is crucial to first time users.
title: Confusing subscription!

review: This is a really great app for people with anxiety. Even if you don’t have anxiety I feel that anyone could benefit from this app. It opens self-awareness and keeps you focused on how you feel. Sometimes we all feel bad and this app really helps with that. After 6 days it starts tracking your status of how you feel. To get the most accurate information you have to constantly check-in. Which in theory is worth it because it helps you but is kinda bad because some people have a busy schedule. Also the price!! $47.00 a year!! That may sound like a bargain but it’s not really a revolutionary app. Plenty of other apps have the same features this one just includes more detail. Which I understand some people may need but for me, a daily reminder to breath is really all I need. So my basic look at it is shop around- Even though this app may seem like the best option plenty of others do just as well.

review: First off, this was my favorite app. Hands down, it was the best for so many reasons! I could log info away, share photos of important memories, be encouraged by little reminders, and review past entries. That was all with the old version.  However, the new format has made it so I cannot go back and add entries for previous days! This is a huge problem because I would journal about the previous day when I would wake up in the morning. It is no longer user-friendly either. I have given it some time, trying to adapt but frankly, the old format was SO.MUCH.NICER. Very disappointing!

review:
I might write a long review so if you want, scroll down by this symbol: to where it brings you to a smaller part of my opinion. 

        Over all I love this app. Very calming, anxiety and stress relief, and stress the best. Then again the premium offers aren’t the best part of this app, that is the only flaw. 
        The lifetime plan makes you pay $299.99 which I think is ridiculous. He yearly plan makes you pay $29.99 which is better but still not the best. The monthly plan makes you pay $9.99 which isn’t bad but it can get annoying paying that kind of money each month. Also it doesn’t even give a choice for a free trial. A free trial would’ve been great because if I didn’t like how premium worked I could decide if I needed to keep paying for the plan, or if I just stayed with how it was without premium. 
        And then the last thing, it is glitchy. I was typing out how my day went with the app one day, then it was typing what I wanted to type at some time and then it exited out of the app it’s own, then it deleted my two paragraphs of work I wrote. Thank you for reading this!

Hello I see that you wanted to scroll Here to this symbol  so you didn’t have to read the whole thing. Over all I like the app, I don’t love it. It has some bugs to fix and premium plans that need to be fixed, like example, add a free trial. Thank you for reading this!

title: Used to love it

review: So I really like this app. In fact, I love this app. I have used it for a year now and it’s helped me to process how my day was and reflect on the things I did. HOWEVER, today (5/17/2020) I received an update on the app that changed it completely. I hate the update! The way it used to be structured was so much better. It would ask me these little daily questions like, “do you think people really ever change?” Or “what’s the worst thing you’ve ever spent money on”, and it was like I could talk about all these random little things but it feels great to put it out there. There would be a spot to talk about my day AND a notes space. There are so many more ways that the old way was better and as a person who uses the app everyday, I would appreciate it if you sent out another update putting it back the way it was. With the old way it was structured way, way, WAY better. By the way lol I don’t have anger issues, bipolar disorder, etc. I just like logging my day and talking about it.

review:
I recommend to all!!! Helps you go through tough times. Reflectly is like your own personal diary.This app even has your on Face ID/Fingerprint to open up the app to keep your privacy safe!!! Like how cool is that!! I think it’s very thoughtful for our personal space well I think all these mental health apps are very thoughtful and they have good intentions but some apps just don’t work.But it’s ok! I would also like to recommend some things to make the app more AWSOME then it already is.

Recommend:
-Instead of having a different app (Vent) for talking to ppl about your health there should be a section on the bottom where it’s (Vent) the app but right there in the app Reflectly. I think it’s way easier for others.But this is just my opinion!

-Add somewhere in the app where we can tell the app what our mood is and why and then either Reflectly answers or Reflectly keeps it and shows your different moods through the week/month/year to see if you have improved your mental health.

-You should add a calendar that keeps track of your moods as well where it shows each mood on the calendar.

-We should have someone to like talk to (In this case Reflectly) we tell him what’s wrong and he responds with what to help us with it would help us a lot more!!! 

Hopefully you will add at least one of these features to your AMAZING app and thank you for your thoughtfulness!🥰

review: @DeondraDDavis wrote a review a YEAR ago that is very similar to what I think about this app, and I’m kind of upset the developers haven’t updated some of the points she brought up. In particular, as a premium payer, I was disappointed to find out I couldn’t copy and paste. This feature is important to me since my thoughts are all over the place (as you might be able to tell from this review), and so if I have the need to write my thoughts immediately, and I want to skip all the questions about how my day was or whatever options I have to click through to get to finally writing in Reflectly, I opt for opening the Notes app, and just pouring out my thoughts and feelings. But since I love the privacy of Reflectly and that it’s literally the best diary ever, I found it annoying when I later attempted to copy my note and paste it into my journal entry for the day and couldn’t. I ended up having to screenshot the note and upload it as a picture, which was time consuming. So please just add a copy and paste feature. Also, of a bit lesser annoyance, why would one of my journal entries be listed twice? There’s two copies for April 24th. I don’t know how that happened. And lastly, there’s a glitch that happens, I’m not exactly sure what triggers it, but sometimes it’s as though part of the screen is not showing. It’s usually the bottom part of the screen that has options I need to tap, but can’t because for some strange reason only half of the button is showing, and I can’t scroll down any further. For example, the last time I noticed it was when editing yesterday’s entry last night. When I had finished, I looked for the “save changes” button, but it wasn’t showing at the bottom, like it usually does, so I tapped on the “X” at the top right of the screen, and it said my changes wouldn’t be saved. So I went back to look for the save changes button again or any other way to exit the entry. I didn’t find any, so I went with the “X”, exited the app, reopened it, and my changes had been saved, which was good, but my point is, why weren’t part of the screen options showing?Thanks beforehand for reading this!
title: I love it, but could use some minor fixes

Most people seeing this review probably are not rich. The rich people are probably off taking fencing lessons. Or horse-backing. I am not criticizing this app. I am criticizing my job. I hate it. I am poor because of it. I QUIT.

review: I love this app. It’s amazing. And I’ve only been using it for a week or so. Now your wondering why I gave it four stars and not five. Well there’s a few things I don’t like about it and think they should kinda be fixed. Anyway like I way saying...If you the person who just loves to write down your feelings and talk about them then this app is for you. (LOOK NO FURTHER). But if you someone like me who likes to look at there past days( like daily moods or streaks) then you would have to pay some money. (Which I’m broke and have non). But. Other wise I love this app. I love how you can do different things. There’s also one more thing. It’s that when I try to see my stats it say you have to weight this many day or this many. And I’m kinda of impatient when it come to weighting. Keep in mind I’m also like a week new to this as well.anyway I just don’t really like that you would have to weight for things or engender pay for them. So yea there’s ALL the things that I don’t really like about this app. Otherwise I LOVE everything else. I like how you can kind of talk to “someone” about your feelings and how your day has been. Like I don’t know if I’m the only one but I don’t really like talking to my family about things. They just make everything seem like it’s my fault and it’s mainly not my fault. It’s other people’s fault for getting on my nerves. Also I’m not that type of person to type really long ratings or even rate apps in that matter. But this was so good that I just had too. Anyway I hope you all enjoy this app and have a nice night or day. ☺️☺️

title: Suggest to others

review: This app is perfect for getting out your feelings and to mark each day, in the future I’m glad I can look back at this and see my dumb choices in action!!! I can write about friends, family, my girlfriend, and all of it! Please buy this they send notifications to remind you to write and you can always go back and write more! 1000/10 would download again💕
title: Love!

review: I loved this app and it’s helped me tremendously after some hard days at school and stuff. But, I don’t know if other people are like me but I was dying to know what my personal stats were (after a week of stories they give u your personal stats) and so, I just finished my week of stories and I went to find out what mine were. I check and then a thing pops up for the premium feature that this app has. I thought that it was being annoying and just showing me the ad. I exited the ad, and then I click to find out what they were and then I realized that YOU HAVE TO BUY PREMIUM IN ORDER TO FIND OUT WHAT YOUR STATS ARE. I’m sorry, but I think that if a person uses this app as much as I do, you shouldn’t have to pay to see the rest of the app. You could even just give us a preview, but something!!! I’m not paying $10.00 a month just for some stupid stats!! (I’m sorry I just get really aggressive) But please, give some people like me who don’t have the money some premium features cus I know their are some people who use this app as much as me (sometimes even more than me) Please. Thank you for reading my review.

title: Cool game

review: At first I thought Reflecty was supposed to be an app where you can talk about your day and what not.... turns out it cost 40+ dollars to use!!! Of course I find this out AFTER I made an account. I tried to delete my account but you need some code or something to DELETE YOUR ACCOUNT!!!! Reflecty does not put any of that in the description! I decided to log out and delete the app, hoping that I won’t be charged. I looked all of this up afterward and you do need to pay. DO NOT GET APP!!!!!
title: COST! PLEASE READ!!!!!

review: Every time I have a notification from this app, It makes me want to reflect what I have done and how I feel throughout the day. I’m not one to talk about my feelings or talk about what I have done throughout the day but I feel motivated for the next day if I had a bad day. It’s definitely worth your time and your subscription. Take it from me ,I’m not a huge fan of subscriptions(including Netflix nor Hulu).

title: AMAZING

review: This app has so far really helped me keep track of my moods throughout the day. Which is very helpful because I always used to focus on the negative, but now I can look back on the things that made me happy throughout the day. It also helps me feel more accomplished with the stuff I have gotten done during the day and it makes me feel better seeing all the productive things I’ve done that day.
So far this app is helping me and letting me journal in one single place and have it all organized.
